thread.title: Grizzly water polo picks up wins
thread.title_full: Grizzly water polo picks up wins

title: Grizzly water polo picks up wins
text: Grizzly water polo picks up wins Comment Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 7:30 PM Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 7:30 PM » Social News The Ashland boys water polo team won all four of its matches and the girls squad was victorious in two of its three matches during conference action last Friday and Saturday on the road. The Grizzly boys beat South Albany, 17-7, on Friday, with goalkeeper Vincent Wright recording six blocks, five assists and two steals. Alex Dobry had three goals and two assists and Luke Abell three goals and two steals. In an 18-5 victory over Marist, Wright had seven blocks, Devon Lancaster and Abell four goals and Erik Oline and Finn Griffin three goals. On Saturday, Ashland beat North Eugene, 11-3, with Wright registering eight blocks and six steals, Griffin three goals and three steals, Lancaster two goals and two assists and Oline two goals. The Grizzlies downed Cottage Grove, 17-3, with Wright recording six blocks, Abell four goals and five steals, Lancaster four goals, three steals and two assists and Oline four goals. The Ashland girls beat South Albany, 19-8, on Friday, with goalkeeper Izzy Nicolier registering five blocks, four assists and three steals, Fiona Johnson five goals and Amelia Covert-Zeve five goals and two assists. On Saturday, the Grizzlies beat North Eugene, 8-6. Nicolier had five blocks and two steals, Covert-Zeve four goals and Zee Harrison two goals. In a 10-5 loss to Cottage Grove, Nicolier tallied 11 blocks and Covert-Zeve three goals. Golf WEB.COM : At Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla., Ashland’s Jason Allred shot an even-par 70 to finish tied for 62nd place during the final round of the Web.com Tour Finals-ending Tour Championship Sunday at TPC Sawgrass’ Dye’s Valley Course. Argentina's Emiliano Grillo made a 25-foot birdie putt on the final hole to win. The 23-year-old Grillo beat Chez Reavie by a stroke in the last of the four events that replaced PGA Tour qualifying school, finishing with a 1-under 69 for a 14-under 266 total. Reavie had a chance to force a playoff, but missed a 15-foot birdie putt. He shot a 68. Boxing LOCALS COMPETE IN RENO : At Reno, Nev., Spartan Boxing’s Julianna Stores won her bout at the Carson City Boxing Club’s Let’s Get Ready to Rumble event. Stores defeated Cindy Corona of Arbuckle, Calif. Also, Cole Burkhart was triumphant against Anthony Gomez of Carson City, Nev. Uriel Ibarra and Sebastian Tovar also represented Spartan Boxing. Drag Racing CHAMPION RACEWAY : At White City, Dan Holscher (hot rod), Tyler Linville (street dot), Freesia Hunter (sport compact), Jason Sauer (motorcycle), Derek Wolf (quads) and Jared Scherrer (high school) were the winners during racing action at Champion Raceway last weekend. The racing season concludes this Saturday. Action will include the street legal series, diesel, VW, Street Outlaw, Big Tire/Small Tire and Power Wheels. Spectators are encouraged to donate an unwrapped toy. For more information, visit championraceway.com or call 541-290-3724. HOT ROD — WINNER: Dan Holscher ('68 Impala); RUNNER-UP: Jon Ruff ('82 Camaro). STREET DOT — WINNER: Tyler Linville ('65 El Camino); RUNNER-UP: Kevin Barden ('65 Mustang). SPORT COMPACT — WINNER: Freesia Hunter ('01 Accord); RUNNER-UP: Ryan Cornelison ('88 Jetta). MOTORCYCLE — WINNER: Jason Sauer ('12 ZX14); RUNNER-UP: Jerry Stinson (Unknown). QUADS — WINNER: Derek Wolf ('08 700 Raptor); RUNNER UP: Ann Alfrey (YZ450). HIGH SCHOOL — WINNER: Jared Scherrer ('71 Vega); RUNNER-UP: Mandi Fremming ('69 R/T). MailTribune.com
